intro: Potentilla sergievskajae, commonly known as the Sergeyevskaya cinquefoil, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically divided into five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla sergievskajae is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
